suggestions: Third Party Beneficiaries; Assignment. The Receiving Party is executing this Agreement for the benefit of the Disclosing Party, and the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to enforce the terms hereof. This Agreement is for the sole benefit of the Parties hereto and their respective successors and permitted assigns, and nothing herein, express or implied, is intended to or shall confer upon any other person or entity any legal or equitable right, benefit, or remedy of any nature whatsoever under or by reason of this Agreement. Disclosing Party has the right to assign all of its rights under this Agreement to any of its affiliates or to a successor in interest to the business of the Disclosing Party, including the right to enforce this Agreement, and the Receiving Party hereby consents to such assignment. The Receiving Party shall not assign any of its rights or delegate any of its duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, and such assignment or delegation in violation hereof shall be void.
originalTexts: Third Party Beneficiaries; Assignment. The Receiving Party is executing this Agreement for the benefit of the Disclosing Party, and the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to enforce the terms hereof. Disclosing Party has the right to assign all of its rights under this Agreement to any of its affiliates or to a successor in interest to the business of the Disclosing Party, including the right to enforce this Agreement, and the Receiving Party hereby consents to such assignment. The Receiving Party shall not assign any of its rights or delegate any of its duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, and such assignment or delegation in violation hereof shall be void.
